revised_title: An Uncommon Dental Phenomenon in Aged Persons
tldr: This article shares two case studies of elderly individuals who experienced tooth regeneration. Joseph Shute, aged 81, noticed a new tooth growing in his upper jaw, while Maria Stert, aged 75, had two new teeth grow in her mouth after being toothless for 25 years. Both individuals found the new teeth to be functional and painless. The article is supported by signatures from the subjects and witnesses, including Sir William Strode and Mr. Colepresse.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Human biology
